snippet: David Samson, one of the closest advisers to Gov. Chris Christie, has raised the issue of stepping down, according to government officials.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column opines that David Samson, chairman of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey and one of the closest advisers to New Jersey Gov Chris Christie, is a little-known potentate in that state's politics; notes he is a pivotal figure in efforts to contain the scandal around the closing of access lanes at the George Washington Bridge, and has again raised the subject of stepping down.

byline.contributor: David W. Chen and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: David Samson, one of the closest advisers to Gov. Chris Christie, has raised the issue of stepping down, according to government officials.
